advice: You may have a viral or bacterial infection. Stay hydrated, rest, and consider paracetamol if needed. If fever persists for more than 2 days, consult a doctor.
Headaches are often caused by stress, dehydration, or lack of sleep. Drink water, rest in a quiet place, and avoid screen time. If severe or frequent, consult a doctor.
It looks like a common cold. Drink warm fluids, take steam inhalation, and rest. Symptoms usually improve in a few days.
A cough may be due to throat irritation or infection. Drink warm water, avoid dust/smoke, and use honey with warm water. If cough lasts more than 2 weeks, consult a doctor.
Sore throat is often due to infection or allergies. Gargle with warm salt water, drink warm fluids, and rest your voice.
Stomach pain can be caused by indigestion or gastritis. Eat light meals, avoid spicy/oily foods, and drink warm water. If pain is severe, consult a doctor.
Diarrhea may be due to infection or food intolerance. Drink ORS (oral rehydration solution) and fluids to avoid dehydration. If it continues, consult a doctor.
Constipation can be relieved by drinking more water, eating fiber-rich foods, and exercising regularly. If persistent, consult a doctor.
Vomiting may be due to indigestion or infection. Drink small sips of water, avoid solid food until you feel better. If continuous, seek medical help.
Dizziness may occur due to dehydration or low blood pressure. Sit down immediately, drink fluids, and rest. If persistent, consult a doctor.
Fatigue may result from lack of sleep, stress, or poor diet. Take rest, eat nutritious food, and stay hydrated.
Shortness of breath can be serious. Sit upright, stay calm, and seek immediate medical attention if severe or sudden.
Chest pain may indicate a heart or lung problem. This can be urgent â€” seek emergency care immediately.
Back pain may result from poor posture or strain. Rest, apply a warm compress, and maintain good posture.
Joint pain may be due to strain or arthritis. Rest, apply warm compress, and do gentle exercises.
Muscle pain may occur after exercise or viral infection. Rest and take warm baths. Gentle stretching may help.
Eye irritation can be caused by allergies or infection. Rinse with clean water and avoid rubbing your eyes.
Blurred vision may indicate eye strain or vision problems. Rest your eyes and get an eye checkup if it continues.
Ear pain may be due to infection or wax buildup. Avoid inserting objects into the ear and consult a doctor if severe.
Tooth pain may indicate dental issues. Rinse with warm salt water and avoid very hot/cold foods. Visit a dentist if pain persists.
Bleeding gums may be due to poor oral hygiene or vitamin deficiency. Brush gently and consult a dentist.
Skin rash may be due to allergy or infection. Avoid scratching and apply soothing lotion. If spreading, consult a doctor.
Acne is often related to hormones or oily skin. Wash face twice daily and avoid oily foods.
Allergy symptoms can be controlled by avoiding triggers like dust and pollen. Take antihistamines if recommended by a doctor.
Asthma can cause breathing problems. Use your inhaler if prescribed. If severe attack occurs, seek emergency care.
Burning urination may be a urinary infection. Drink plenty of water. If it continues, consult a doctor.
Frequent urination may be due to infection or diabetes. Monitor fluid intake and consult a doctor if persistent.
Menstrual cramps are common. Use a hot water bag and rest. Over-the-counter pain relief may help if necessary.
Irregular periods may be due to stress, hormonal imbalance, or PCOS. Track cycles and consult a gynecologist if frequent.
Morning sickness is common in pregnancy. Eat small meals and stay hydrated. Consult a gynecologist for proper care.
Unexplained weight loss can indicate underlying illness. Maintain a balanced diet and consult a doctor if ongoing.
Weight gain may be due to poor diet or hormonal imbalance. Eat healthy, exercise regularly, and consult a doctor if rapid.
Insomnia can be caused by stress or lifestyle. Avoid caffeine, use relaxation techniques, and maintain sleep hygiene.
Anxiety may cause palpitations and fear. Practice deep breathing, relaxation, and consult a mental health professional if needed.
Depression may cause low mood and fatigue. Talk to a trusted person, exercise, and seek help from a counselor or doctor.
Mild forgetfulness can be due to stress or aging. If severe or worsening, consult a neurologist.
High BP may not show symptoms. Reduce salt, exercise regularly, and monitor pressure. Consult a doctor for medication.
Low BP can cause dizziness. Drink water, eat small meals, and rest. Seek medical care if persistent.
Diabetes requires medical monitoring. Eat a balanced diet, exercise, and take prescribed medicines regularly.
Anemia may cause weakness and pale skin. Eat iron-rich foods like spinach, lentils, and consult a doctor.
These may be COVID-19 symptoms. Isolate yourself, wear a mask, monitor oxygen, and consult a doctor for testing.
Flu causes fever, cough, and body ache. Rest, hydrate, and take paracetamol if needed. Consult a doctor if severe.
Food poisoning can cause vomiting and diarrhea. Drink ORS, rest, and eat bland food. If severe dehydration occurs, consult a doctor.
Sunburn causes redness and pain. Apply aloe vera gel and stay hydrated. Avoid sun exposure until healed.
Heat stroke is an emergency. Move to a cool place, drink water, and seek immediate medical help.
Dehydration causes weakness and dizziness. Drink water or ORS immediately.
Allergic reactions may cause rashes or swelling. Take an antihistamine if available. If breathing difficulty occurs, seek emergency help.
